headline: Amazon, Salesforce, Uber: Trending tickers
summary: Here are some stocks on the move on Monday, April 21. Shares of Amazon (AMZN) are slipping. Raymond James downgraded its rating on the stock to Outperform from Strong Buy. Salesforce (CRM) shares were downgraded to Underperform by DA Davidson, while Guggenheim upgraded the stock to Neutral. The Federal Trade Commission has sued Uber (UBER) accusing the company of deceptive billing practices in relation to its Uber One service. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: RH, Boot Barn, Ollie's, Universal Health Services, and Salesforce Shares Plummet, What You Need To Know
summary: A number of stocks fell in the afternoon session after President Trump criticized the Federal Reserve's approach to interest rate cuts, warning that the pace was slow and could hinder economic growth. Trump's comments added pressure to an already sensitive market, raising concerns about political interference in monetary policy.

headline: Salesforce, Disney, Spotify: Wall Street upgrades & downgrades
summary: Here are some of the stocks moving on Wall Street analyst calls. Salesforce (CRM) is in focus after receiving both an upgrade and a downgrade. Guggenheim raised its rating on the tech giant's shares to Neutral, while DA Davidson cut its rating to Underperform. Wolfe Research made moves on a couple of media stocks, raising its ratings on both Walt Disney (DIS) and Spotify (SPOT) to Outperform. Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Alexandra Canal reports the details in the video above. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here.

headline: Salesforce core business neglected on AI pivot, DA Davidson says downgrading co
summary: Investing.com -- DA Davidson downgraded Salesforce.com (NYSE:CRM) to Underperform from Neutral, saying the company is prioritizing its artificial intelligence ambitions at the expense of its core business, which is showing signs of broad deceleration.

headline: Guggenheim upgrades Salesforce, removes price target after recent decline
summary: Investing.com -- Guggenheim upgraded Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) to Neutral from Sell after the recent 26% pullback in the stock since January, which brings the share price closer to the brokerage’s prior price target of $247.
